infotexts:
Soundproof Walls [version] Opens the Soundproof Walls settings menu. Opens the Soundproof Walls welcome popup. Opens the Soundproof Walls workshop page in your browser. Opens the Soundproof Walls Configuration Guide page in your browser. Opens the Soundproof Walls Report Bugs page in your browser. Finished loading Soundproof Walls v[version] > Open the settings menu by typing "spw".
 > Print your stats with "spw_stats".
 > Have a question? Open the workshop page with "spw_workshop" and leave a comment.
 > Found a bug? Open the bug discussion page with "spw_report" and make a post.
 > Learn more about config options with "spw_help".
 > Re-open the first-time launch popup by typing "spw_welcome".
Syncing Enabled!
You are using a config uploaded to the server by [name]. Values from this config are shown in parentheses next to yours. Syncing Enabled!
Your config has been uploaded to the server and is being used by all other players. Syncing Disabled!
The server has no config uploaded. You are using your local config.Looking for your config file? Default values are blue.
Custom values are yellow.
Vanilla values are white.

Looking for your config file?
You can find it at:
[path]Edit Permission:
You are the host of this session. Changes will be uploaded to the server and used by all other players.Edit Permission:
You are an admin in this session. Changes will be uploaded to the server and used by all other players.Edit Permission:
You are not the host of this session. Changes will be saved locally but will not apply while server syncing is enabled.Edit Permission:
You are not an admin in this session. Changes will be saved locally but will not apply while server syncing is enabled.MuffleGainReverbGeneralVisualsGeneralEnable ModGlobally toggles all features of the mod.Sync SettingsToggles the synchronization of settings between players.

If enabled, the host automatically uploads their config to the server to be shared with all players. This upload happens once at the start of a session or whenever changes are made. Players are forced to use this config regardless of their local config settings, which remain unchanged.Effect Processing ModeHow audio effects are processed. Dynamic mode is recommended.

Note: Changing this setting while playing may briefly freeze the game as buffers are loaded.ClassicVanilla-style muffling with one muffle preset. Minimal resource use.StaticAdds light and medium muffle presets plus optional reverb. Slightly longer load times and higher memory usage (~250 MB).DynamicAdvanced real-time effects via OpenAL. Most realistic audio with simulated reverb, distortion, and advanced muffling, at higher CPU cost.

Note: If you're concerned about performance, enable the "Show Performance" setting (Advanced tab) to see detailed stats.Focus Target AudioSimulate audio from the perspective of the current camera target (i.e., you hear what the turret hears).Realistic Sound FalloffCalculates volume falloff using the sound's path to the listener. If disabled, simple straight-line (Euclidean) distance is used instead.Sound Range MasterGlobal range multiplier for all non-looping sounds.

Note: Stacks multiplicatively with the sound-specific range multiplier assigned by the "Custom Sounds" list in the Advanced tab.Looping Sound Range MasterGlobal range multiplier for all looping sounds.

Note: Stacks multiplicatively with the sound-specific range multiplier assigned by the "Custom Sounds" list in the Advanced tab.Dynamic ModeSound OcclusionMuffles sounds that don't have a direct line of sight to the player's ears due to walls.Max OcclusionsHow many layers of walls a sound can be occluded by.

Note: Limiting occlusion may result in an audibly more consistent muffle when faced with unusual wall configurations. Setting this value to zero disables the limit.Over-MuffleDynamically reduces the volume of sounds near and above the maximum effective muffle strength of 1.0.Muffle Strength MasterThe overall strength of the dynamic muffle effect.Over-Muffle StrengthHow much influence high muffle values have on reducing sound volume.Enable ReverbToggles the indoor and outdoor reverb effects. If enabled, sounds dynamically reverberate based on the size and combined audio amplitude of their environment (i.e., echos are stronger in larger and quieter spaces).Reverb BloomMakes the reverb effect swell dramatically in response to loud sounds in confined areas.Dynamic Reverb AreaCalculates reverb using air area when above water, or water area when submerged. If disabled, uses the area of both.Minimum Reverb AreaThe minimum combined area of connected rooms around the listener required for reverberation to be applied.Reverb Area ScaleScales the effective area of the current indoor environment. Larger values increase decay time and delay of reflections, making the space sound bigger.Wet Room Reverb ScaleMultiplies the effective area of ballast tanks and airlocks when the listener is inside them, making these rooms sound larger and more reverberant.Indoor Reverb StrengthThe base gain of the reverb effect when inside a hull.Indoor Reverb DurationThe decay time of the reverb effect when inside a hull.Indoor Reverb HF GainThe gain of high frequencies in the reverb effect when inside a hull.Indoor Reverb ThresholdThe minimum sound amplitude required for a sound to produce reverb when the listener is indoors.Outdoor Reverb StrengthThe base gain of the reverb effect when outside.Outdoor Reverb DiffusionThe smoothness of the reverb effect when outside.Outdoor Reverb DurationThe decay time of the reverb effect when outside.Outdoor Reverb HF GainThe gain of high frequencies in the reverb effect when outside.Outdoor Reverb ThresholdThe minimum sound amplitude required for a sound to produce reverb when the listener is outside.Unsubmerged DistortionSubmerged DistortionEnable Unsubmerged DistortionEnable Submerged DistortionIf the listener is not submerged, applies the unsubmerged distortion effect to sounds referenced in the "Custom Sounds" list (Advanced tab) with distortion set to true.If the listener is submerged, applies the submerged distortion effect to sounds referenced in the "Custom Sounds" list (Advanced tab) with distortion set to true.Distortion Muffle RequirementThe maximum muffle strength a sound can have before its distortion is disabled.Distortion GainThe volume of the distortion.Distortion EdgeThe harshness of the distortion. A higher value results in a more intense effect.Distortion FrequencyThe EQ center of the distortion. Frequencies near this value will be affected more by the effect.Distortion Lowpass FrequencyA lowpass filter is applied to the distorted signal in post. This is the corner frequency used by that lowpass filter.ExperimentalCleanup Unused BuffersLoad sounds without their vanilla muffle buffer to save ~100MB of memory over vanilla. Disabled by default due to concerns of potential compatibility issues with other mods that interact with sound objects on a low level. However, in the vast majority of cases, this setting is a free boost.

Note: Changing this setting while playing may briefly freeze the game as buffers are loaded.Static ModeHeavy Lowpass FrequencyThe corner frequency used to muffle sounds that are heavily obstructed. The threshold to apply this filter is configurable in the Muffle tab.

Note: Does not apply to voice chat. See the lowpass frequency sliders in the Voice tab.

Note: Changing this setting while playing may briefly freeze the game as buffers are loaded.Medium Lowpass FrequencyThe corner frequency used to muffle sounds that are moderately obstructed. The threshold to apply this filter is configurable in the Muffle tab.

Note: Does not apply to voice chat. See the lowpass frequency sliders in the Voice tab.

Note: Changing this setting while playing may briefly freeze the game as buffers are loaded.Light Lowpass FrequencyThe corner frequency used to muffle sounds that are lightly obstructed. The threshold to apply this filter is configurable in the Muffle tab.

Note: Does not apply to voice chat. See the lowpass frequency sliders in the Voice tab.

Note: Changing this setting while playing may briefly freeze the game as buffers are loaded.Enable Reverb BuffersLoad sounds with an additional buffer ran through a reverb filter. This feature only applies non-looping and non-muffled sounds.

Note: Uses ~100MB of memory and extends buffer loading times (worsens with duration).

Note: Changing this setting while playing may briefly freeze the game as buffers are loaded.Always Reverb Loud SoundsSounds referenced in the "Custom Sounds" list (Advanced tab) with a sidechain multiplier greater than one ignore the minimum reverb area requirement.Reverb DurationThe decay time and size of the reverb. Increasing this value results in higher memory usage and buffer loading times.Reverb MixThe dry/wet mix of the reverb. A higher value results in a stronger effect.Reverb DampingThe strength of the lowpass filter applied to the reverb feedback.Minimum Reverb AreaThe minimum combined area of connected rooms around the listener required for reverberation to be applied to non-looping and non-muffled sounds.VoiceTalking RagdollsHear non-stunned players speak when they're ragdolled.Local RangeThe range of local proximity chat.Radio RangeThe range of radio proximity chat.Local VolumeThe volume of local proximity chat.

Note: This setting is independent of Barotrauma’s voice chat volume slider.Radio VolumeThe volume of radio proximity chat.

Note: This setting is independent of Barotrauma’s voice chat volume slider.Dynamic Mode ExclusiveReverb LocalAllows reverb to be applied to local proximity chat

Note: Requires Dynamic mode's reverb effect to be enabled.Reverb RadioAllows reverb to be applied to radio proximity chat

Note: Requires Dynamic mode's reverb effect to be enabled.Distort Radio DrowningApplies distortion to radio proximity chat when drowning.

Note: This setting reduces the muffle of radio proximity chat when drowning.Min Lowpass FrequencyThe minimum lowpass frequency applied when fully muffled.Dynamic Muffle StrengthThe strength of obstructions applied to voices when using Dynamic mode.Heavy Voice Lowpass FrequencyThe corner frequency used to muffle voices that are heavily obstructed. The threshold to apply this filter is configurable in the Muffle tab.Medium Voice Lowpass FrequencyThe corner frequency used to muffle voices that are moderately obstructed. The threshold to apply this filter is configurable in the Muffle tab.Light Voice Lowpass FrequencyThe corner frequency used to muffle voices that are lightly obstructed. The threshold to apply this filter is configurable in the Muffle tab.Scream ModeScream ModeLocal proximity chat range scales with input amplitude (screaming is heard from farther away).

Note: For best results, adjust your Barotrauma mic volume so the voice activity meter still has room for loud input. The more dynamic range your mic allows the better.Max Scream RangeThe maximum range of local proximity chat when speaking at full volume with "Scream Mode" enabled.

Note: This setting is affected by the "Local Range" multiplier.Min Scream RangeThe minimum range of local proximity chat with "Scream Mode" enabled.Scream Release RateThe rate at which voice range decreases per second once it’s no longer sustained by amplitude.DrowningDrowning BubblesPlayers speaking underwater without oxygen emit visible bubbles that can be heard locally or over the radio.Local Bubble RangeThe audible range of the local bubbles sound.Local Bubble VolumeThe volume of the local bubbles sound.Radio Bubble VolumeThe volume of the radio bubbles sound.Radio FilterCustom Radio FilterProcess radio proximity chat with a custom filter that includes configurable compression, distortion, and noise effects.Custom Radio PresetsUnique radio filter configurations. Selecting one of these options will modify all the filter values below.BrokenJust terrible. Using the radio is a hinderance.DirtyLow quality radio that can make frantic communications difficult to understand.StandardVanilla radio with a more stylized sound.CleanPerfectly clear radio communications.Radio Bandpass FrequencyThe center frequency of the bandpass filter. Only frequencies near this point are allowed through. 

Note: The width of the range is set by "Radio Bandpass Q Factor" below.Radio Bandpass Q FactorHow narrow the bandpass filter is around its center frequency. Higher values create a tighter, more pronounced effect.Radio Distortion DriveBoosts the voice signal before clipping. Higher values increase distortion intensity.Radio Distortion ThresholdMaximum allowed level. Samples exceeding this limit are hard-clipped.Radio StaticThe intensity of static noise added to radio transmissions.Radio Compression ThresholdThe input level where compression begins. Sounds below this level are unaffected.Radio Compression RatioHow much volume above the threshold is reduced. Higher ratios mean stronger compression and less dynamic range.Post Filter Gain BoostThe overall output level after radio filtering.MuffleMuffle Diving SuitsApply the "Diving Suit" obstruction to all sounds when wearing a diving suit.Muffle Submerged PlayerApply the "Water Body" obstruction to sounds submerged in the same body of water as the player's head.Muffle Submerged View TargetApply the "Water Body" obstruction to sounds submerged in the same body of water as the view target

Note: Requires "Focus Target Audio" (General tab) to be enabled.Muffle Water SurfaceApply the "Water Surface" obstruction to sounds on the opposite side of an air-water barrier.Muffle Flow & Fire PathsMuffle water flow and fire sounds if they do not have a path to the listener.

Note: This feature uses a predictive system which may not be accurate in all situations.Muffle Flow SoundsToggle the muffling of water flow sounds from all sources.Muffle Fire SoundsToggles the muffling of fire sounds from all sources.Classic Lowpass FrequencyThe corner frequency used to muffle sounds in Classic mode. The threshold to apply this filter is configurable in the Muffle tab.

Note: Does not apply to voice chat. See the lowpass frequency sliders in the Voice tab.

Note: Changing this setting while playing may briefly freeze the game as buffers are loaded.Obstruction Muffle StrengthWater SurfaceThe muffle strength applied when a sound crosses an air-water barrier.

Note: Stacks multiplicatively (diminishing returns).Water BodyThe muffle strength applied when a sound travels through water to reach the listener without crossing an air-water barrier (i.e., the sound starts and ends its journey in the same body of water).

Note: Stacks multiplicatively (diminishing returns).Thick WallThe muffle strength applied when a sound passes through a wall normally.

Note: Also applies for every two doors the sound has passed through when using Dynamic mode.

Note: Stacks multiplicatively (diminishing returns).Thin WallThe muffle strength applied when a sound pierces through a wall (propagation or hydrophoning structures) or has a partial path to the listener (occlusion).

Note: Stacks multiplicatively (diminishing returns).Thick DoorThe muffle strength applied when a sound passes through a door normally.

Note: Stacks multiplicatively (diminishing returns).Thin DoorThe muffle strength applied when a sound pierces through a door (eavesdropping, propagation, or inside a container).

Note: Stacks multiplicatively (diminishing returns).Diving SuitThe muffle strength applied when a sound passes through a diving suit.

Note: Also applies to sounds that are outside the submarine when using the hydrophones.

Note: Stacks multiplicatively (diminishing returns).Player DrowningThe muffle strength applied to a player's voice when they speak while drowning.

Note: Stacks multiplicatively (diminishing returns).(Classic) Muffle ThresholdThe minimum combined obstruction level required for sounds to use the "Classic Lowpass Frequency" (Muffle tab).(Static) Light Muffle ThresholdThe minimum combined obstruction level required for sounds and voices to use the "Light Lowpass Frequency" (Static tab) or "Light Voice Lowpass Frequency" (Voice tab).(Static) Medium Muffle ThresholdThe minimum combined obstruction level required for sounds and voices to use the "Medium Lowpass Frequency" (Static tab) or "Medium Voice Lowpass Frequency" (Voice tab).(Static) Heavy Muffle ThresholdThe minimum combined obstruction level required for sounds and voices to use the "Heavy Lowpass Frequency" (Static tab) or "Heavy Voice Lowpass Frequency" (Voice tab).Muffle ThresholdsVolumeSidechainingEnable SidechainingDuck the volume of all sounds when a loud sound plays.

Note: For a sound to be considered loud internally, it must be referenced in the "Custom Sounds" list (Advanced tab) as having a sidechain multiplier greater than zero.Sidechain MusicDuck the volume of music tracks when a loud sound plays.Sidechain Intensity MasterGlobal multiplier applied to all sidechain multipliers in the "Custom Sounds" list (Advanced tab).Sidechain Release MasterFlat amount of time added to all sidechain releases in the "Custom Sounds" list (Advanced tab).Sidechain Release CurveThe exponent used to calculate the shape of the sidechain release curve. Values less than one release slowly and then sharply towards the end. Values above one release quickly and flatten out towards the end.Sidechain Muffle PowerHow strong a muffled sound's sidechain effect should be. Higher values retain more sidechain strength.Sidechain Music StrengthThe intensity of the sidechain effect on music.Muffled Sound VolumeThe volume of muffled non-looping sounds. Blends with "Unmuffled Sound Volume" based on muffle strength.

Note: Stacks additively with other volume multipliers.Unmuffled Sound VolumeThe volume of unmuffled non-looping sounds. Blends with "Muffled Sound Volume" based on muffle strength.

Note: Stacks additively with other volume multipliers.Muffled Voice VolumeThe volume of muffled player voices. Blends with "Unmuffled Voice Volume" based on muffle strength.

Note: Stacks additively with other volume multipliers.Unmuffled Voice VolumeThe volume of unmuffled player voices. Blends with "Muffled Voice Volume" based on muffle strength.

Note: Stacks additively with other volume multipliers.Muffled Looping VolumeThe volume of muffled looping sounds. Blends with "Unmuffled Looping Volume" based on muffle strength.

Note: Stacks additively with other volume multipliers.Unmuffled Looping VolumeThe volume of unmuffled looping sounds. Blends with "Muffled Looping Volume" based on muffle strength.

Note: Stacks additively with other volume multipliers.Submerged Together VolumeThe volume of sounds submerged in the same body of water as the listener.

Note: Stacks additively with other volume multipliers.Flow Sound VolumeThe volume of flowing water caused by leaks in the submarine.Fire Sound VolumeThe volume of fires.Vanilla Exosuit VolumeThe volume of the vanilla exosuit movement sound. Some players find this sound unpleasant to hear.

Note: Does not affect modded exosuit sounds.Component Sound Distance Falloff StartThe distance needed before looping component sound volume starts dropping off.Min Distance Falloff VolumeThe minimum falloff volume a sound can reach using the "Realistic Sound Falloff" model (General tab)."EavesdroppingEavesdropping EnabledToggles the eavesdropping feature.Muffle Own HullMuffle sounds in the listener's hull when eavesdropping.Muffle Eavesdropped HullSlightly muffle sounds heard via eavesdropping by applying the "Thin Door" obstruction.Eavesdropping TransitionSmoothly transition audio between hulls when eavesdropping.Eavesdropping Ducks RadioLower the volume of radio proximity chat when eavesdropping.Eavesdropping BindWhat button is held to eavesdrop.

Note: This setting is not synced with other players when using "Sync Settings" (General tab).Eavesdropped Sound VolumeThe volume of sounds heard from eavesdropping.

Note: Stacks additively with other volume multipliers.Eavesdropped Voice VolumeThe volume of local proximity chat heard from eavesdropping.

Note: Stacks additively with other volume multipliers.Own Hull VolumeThe volume of audio in the listener's hull when eavesdropping.Eavesdropped Sound PitchThe pitch of sounds heard from eavesdropping.

Note: Does not apply to local proximity chat.

Note: Stacks additively with other pitch multipliers.Eavesdropping Max DistanceThe maximum distance the player's head can be from a door while eavesdropping.Eavesdropping Transition DurationHow many seconds the eavesdropping transition takes.

Note: Requires "Eavesdropping Transition" to be enabled.Eavesdropping ThresholdHow far into the eavesdropping transition does the muffle profile switch to the opposite side of the door.Visual FeedbackDisplay a soft green glow effect around eavesdropped sound sources.See Character OutlineDisplay a rough outline of the body part responsible for making the sound (i.e., legs for footsteps and heads for voices).See Inaccessible SoundsDisplay the glow effect for sounds without a path to the eavesdropped area.

Note: Sounds in the listener's hull are always ignored.Max Glow SizeThe maximum size of the glow effect.Glow Size MultiplierThe size of the glow effect relative to the range of the sound.Glow OpacityThe strength of the glow effect.Glow Fade CurveThe exponent used to calculate the shape of the glow fade out curve. Values less than one fade slowly and then sharply towards the end. Values above one fade quickly and flatten out towards the end.Eavesdropping Camera ZoomHow far the camera zooms in when eavesdropping.

Note: May not work with other mods that adjust camera zoom.Vignette OpacityThe strength of the vignette effect around the edges of the screen when eavesdropping.HydrophonesHydrophone Switch EnabledToggles the hydrophone feature.

Note: The hydrophone switch will remain until next round.Movement SoundsHear movement in the water.Hear EnginesHear submarine engines, including your own.Hear Into StructuresHear inside other submarines or outposts.

Note: Sounds in these structures receive the "Thin Wall" obstruction.Muffle Own SubMuffle sounds coming from within your own structure.

Note: Applies the "Water Surface" obstruction.Hydrophone RangeHow far you can hear sounds through the hydrophones.

Note: This distance is summed to the existing range of the sounds.Hydrophone VolumeThe volume of sounds heard through the hydrophones.Hydrophone PitchThe pitch of sounds heard through the hydrophones.

Note: Does not apply to proximity chat.Hydrophone Ambience VolumeThe volume of the ocean ambience that plays when listening to the hydrophones.Hydrophone Movement VolumeThe volume of the water sloshing sound caused by moving characters in the water.Visual FeedbackDisplay colored sectors on the sonar UI that visually represent the direction, size, and implied distance of sounds in the water.

Note: Distance can be implied based on the range of the sound and the width of the highlighted sector.Disable Passive SonarStop drawing sonar blips when monitoring the hydrophones. Sonar blips are what visually display the environment.Disable Sub OutlineStop drawing the outline of the submarine and its docking hatches when monitoring the hydrophones.Visual Feedback SizeThe thickness of the colored sectors.Visual Feedback OpacityThe transparency of the colored sectors.Ethereal EchoesApplies a unique hydrophone reverb that mimics the way distant sounds diffuse, scatter, and reverberate through ice caves and underwater spaces.

Note: Requires "Enable Reverb" (Dynamic tab) to be enabled.Reverb StrengthThe base gain for the unique hydrophone reverb.Distort HydrophonesApply a distortion effect to sounds heard through the hydrophones.Bandpass HydrophonesApply a bandpass filter to sounds heard through the hydrophones. A bandpass filter cuts high and low frequencies, creating a radio-like sound.

Note: Muffling is disabled for sounds using a bandpass filter.Bandpass High Frequency GainThe volume of the bandpass filter's high frequencies.Bandpass Low Frequency GainThe volume of the bandpass filter's low frequencies.AdvancedMuffle Ignored SoundsSounds in this list are never muffled when using the hydrophones.Visual Feedback Ignored SoundsSounds in this list are never displayed on the sonar UI when using the hydrophones.AmbienceDisable White NoiseMute the biome noise loops from the vanilla game.Track-SpecificInside Water VolumeThe volume of the water ambience track that plays inside.

Note: This track continues to play at a lower volume on top of the outside track.Outside Water VolumeThe volume of the water ambience track that plays outside.Moving Water VolumeThe volume of the water ambience track that plays when the submarine or player is moving through water.Environment-SpecificUnsubmerged Water Volume (Suit)The volume of water ambience tracks when the listener is unsubmerged and wearing a diving suit.Unsubmerged Water Volume (No Suit)The volume of water ambience tracks when the listener is unsubmerged and not wearing a diving suit.Submerged Water Volume (Suit)The volume of water ambience tracks when the listener is submerged and wearing a diving suit.Submerged Water Volume (No Suit)The volume of water ambience tracks when the listener is submerged and not wearing a diving suit.Water Ambience Transition SpeedHow fast the water ambience transitions between volume levels.PitchEnable PitchGlobally toggles all pitch effects.

Note: May be helpful as a quick fix for unusual pitch interactions with sounds from other mods.Pitch Status Effect SoundsToggle pitching for sounds played by XML status effects.Pitch With DistanceDynamically lower the pitch of muffled sounds based on their distance.

Note: Does not apply to looping sounds or proximity chat.

Note: Stacks additively with other pitch multipliers.Diving Suit PitchThe pitch of sounds when wearing a diving suit.

Note: Stacks additively with other pitch multipliers.Submerged PitchThe pitch of sounds when the listener is submerged.

Note: Stacks additively with other pitch multipliers.Muffled Sound PitchThe pitch of muffled non-looping sounds. Blends with "Unmuffled Sound Pitch" based on muffle strength.

Note: Stacks additively with other pitch multipliers.Unmuffled Sound PitchThe pitch of unmuffled non-looping sounds. Blends with "Muffled Sound Pitch" based on muffle strength.

Note: Stacks additively with other pitch multipliers.Muffled Looping PitchThe pitch of muffled looping sounds. Blends with "Unmuffled Looping Pitch" based on muffle strength.

Note: Stacks additively with other pitch multipliers.Unmuffled Looping PitchThe pitch of unmuffled looping sounds. Blends with "Muffled Looping Pitch" based on muffle strength.

Note: Stacks additively with other pitch multipliers.Muffled Voice PitchThe pitch of muffled proximity chat. Blends with "Unmuffled Voice Pitch" based on muffle strength.

Note: Stacks additively with other pitch multipliers.

Note: Just for fun :)Unmuffled Voice PitchThe pitch of unmuffled proximity chat. Blends with "Muffled Voice Pitch" based on muffle strength.

Note: Stacks additively with other pitch multipliers.

Note: Just for fun :)AdvancedShow PerformanceDisplay detailed performance information for Soundproof Walls.

Note: This setting is not synced with other players when using "Sync Settings" (General tab).Show Playing SoundsDisplay all actively playing sounds registered by Soundproof Walls.

Note: This setting is not synced with other players when using "Sync Settings" (General tab).Show Channel InfoExtend the "Show Playing Sounds" setting to also display the gain, pitch, range, distance, muffle, and obstructions for all actively playing sounds.

Note: If "Show Playing Sounds" is disabled, this information is logged in the Barotrauma console.

Note: This setting is not synced with other players when using "Sync Settings" (General tab).Hide Menu ButtonRemove the "Soundproof Walls" button from the pause menu. The Soundproof Walls settings menu can still be accessed by typing "spw" in the console.

Note: This setting is not synced with other players when using "Sync Settings" (General tab).Remember Menu PositionOpen the menu at the last scroll position and tab visited.

Note: This setting is not synced with other players when using "Sync Settings" (General tab).Max Playing SoundsHow many sounds can be playing at the same time. Higher values prevent sounds from being skipped but may impact performance.Max Simultaneous InstancesHow many instances of the same sound can be playing at the same time. Higher values prevent sounds from being skipped but may impact performance.Update IntervalsUpdate Non-Looping SoundsAllow non-looping sounds to be modified while they are playing, giving cut-off potential to sounds that previously couldn't be interrupted.

Note: May slightly impact performance.Non-Looping Sound Update IntervalThe amount of time between each obstruction update for non-looping sounds.

Note: Requires "Update Non-Looping Sounds" to be enabled.

Note: Increasing this value may improve performance.OpenAL Effects Update IntervalThe amount of time between each effect parameter update for effects in Dynamic mode.

Note: Increasing this value may improve performance.Voice Update IntervalThe amount of time between each obstruction update for player voices.

Note: Increasing this value may improve performance.Component Sound Update IntervalThe amount of time between each obstruction update for looping component sounds (e.g., vents, reactor, engine).

Note: Increasing this value may improve performance.Status Effect Sound Update IntervalThe amount of time between each obstruction update for looping status effect sounds (e.g., sounds from afflictions).

Note: Increasing this value may improve performance.TransitionsDisable Vanilla Fade OutDisables the vanilla "FadeOutAndDispose" method. Only enable this option if sounds are getting stuck looping.

Note: Results in less smooth audio cutoffs.Gain Transition SpeedHow much a sound's volume can change per second. A value of zero disables this feature for instant transitions.Pitch Transition SpeedHow much a sound's pitch can change per second. A value of zero disables this feature for instant transitions.Indoor Reverb Transition SpeedHow much the indoor reverb effect's gain can change per second. A value of zero disables this feature for instant transitions.Hydrophone Reverb Transition SpeedHow much the hydrophone reverb effect's gain can change per second. A value of zero disables this feature for instant transitions.Muffle Transition SpeedHow much the Dynamic mode's muffle effect can change per second. A value of zero disables this feature for instant transitions.

Note: This feature can produce audible pops when enabled, presumably a symptom of Barotrauma's OpenAL Soft version.Flow & Fire Muffle Transition SpeedHow much the Dynamic mode's muffle effect can change per second for water flow and fire sounds. A value of zero disables this feature for instant transitions.

Note: This feature can produce audible pops when enabled, presumably a symptom of Barotrauma's OpenAL Soft version.Sound PathfindingTraverse Water DuctsAllow sounds to pass through open water ducts unobstructed.Flow Sounds Traverse Water DuctsAllow the estimation of a flow sound's path to pass through open water ducts unobstructed.

Note: Requires "Muffle Flow & Fire Paths" (Muffle tab) to be enabled.Open Door ThresholdHow open a door, hatch, or duct must be for sound to pass through unobstructed. A value of zero allows sounds to pass through fully closed doors unobstructed.Open Wall ThresholdHow open a gap in a wall must be for sound to pass through unobstructed.Sound Propagation RangeThe maximum distance that a sound in the "Wall Propagating Sounds" list (Advanced tab) can search for a nearby hull to propagate into.Character AIAI Sound RangeThe distance that character AI can hear items and characters.

Note: Singleplayer only.AI Sight RangeThe distance that character AI can see items and characters.

Note: Singleplayer only.Sound RulesCustom SoundsApply custom values and effects to specific sounds.

"Keyword": Part of the target sound's file name. Case insensitive.

"GainMult": Volume multiplier. Stacks additively with other volume multipliers.

"RangeMult": Range multiplier. Stacks multiplicatively with other range multipliers.

"SidechainMult": The volume that other sounds are reduced by when this sound plays.

"SidechainRelease": The duration that the volume reduction lasts for.

"Distortion": Toggles the distortion effect for this sound. Dynamic mode only.

"PitchMult": Pitch multiplier. Works by stretching the sound's length. Ranges between 0.25-4.0.

"MuffleInfluence": Effectiveness of muffle effects. Lower values mean less affected.

"KeywordExclusions": Sounds that contain the provided Keyword but should be excluded. Case insensitive.Custom sound values from [modname]. Takes override priority over the standard "Custom Sounds" list.

This list is not synced with other players and any changes will not persist beyond the current session.

Soundproof Walls is not responsible for the contents of this list.Ignored SoundsSounds in this list are ignored by all processing.Water Surface Ignored SoundsSounds in this list pass through air-water barriers unobstructed.Water Body Ignored SoundsSounds in this list travel through water unobstructed.

Note: Does not affect how sounds interact with water surfaces.Wall Propagating SoundsSounds in this list are able to jump into nearby hulls to better reach the player, receiving a "Thin Wall" obstruction instead of "Thick Wall".Pitch Ignored SoundsSounds in this list have their pitch forced to 1.0.

Note: The sound-specific pitch multiplier in the "Custom Sounds" list (Advanced tab) overrides this list.Reverb Forced SoundsSounds in this list will always receive the reverb effect if possible.

Note: Exclusive to the "Dynamic" and "Static" effect modes.Indoor Reverb Ignored SoundsSounds in this list never receive the indoor reverb effect.

Note: Exclusive to the "Dynamic" and "Static" effect modes.Outdoor Reverb Ignored SoundsSounds in this list never receive the outdoor reverb effect.

Note: Exclusive to the "Dynamic" effect mode.Barrier Ignored SoundsSounds in this list are not muffled by occlusion, walls, doors, or water surfaces.XML Ignored SoundsThis list is for sounds marked internally with the "dontmuffle" tag or similar properties. Sounds in this list will always be evaluated for muffling.Lowpass Ignored SoundsSounds in this list will never receive muffle effects.Container Ignored SoundsSounds in this list pass through any containers that they're stored in unobstructed.Drowning Exempt PlayersInsert player names in this list to grant them immunity from the drowning bubbles effect caused by speaking underwater without an oxygen supply.modified settings - the server config has been updateddisabled setting synchronization - local configs now take priorityMonitor HydrophonesThe active server config has [count] changes from your local config:Listening...Loading audio buffers...Invalid InputEnabledDisabledDefaultVanillaCustomLinearInstantPer TickConcaveConvexsResetReset AllWelcome to Soundproof Walls 2.0Soundproof Walls 2.0 is a fully rewritten and expanded version of the original mod and stands as a complete audio system overhaul for Barotrauma.Major Changes• Environmentally Simulated ReverbSounds and player voices echo realistically based on the size and volume of the room. Outside the submarine, loud sounds can be heard scattering for miles as the soundwaves bounce off the frozen walls of Europa.• Sidechain Compression SystemGunshots and explosions hit harder, drowning out quieter sounds for a wider, more powerful dynamic range.• Dynamic Lowpass FrequencySounds are no longer limited to being muffled at one set strength and will now dynamically adapt based on the situation and how many obstructions are in the way.• Sound OcclusionSounds are muffled by the shape of the surrounding level geometry as they explore their path to the player's ears.• Powerful DistortionGunshots, explosions, and other loud sounds distort violently in the air and pulse deeply in the water.• Better Voice ChatFine-tune your radio from crystal clear to completely broken and try out the new local proximity chat system that dynamically adjusts how far your voice carries based on how loud you're yelling.• Overhauled SystemsEavesdropping and hydrophone systems have received a full makeover with new visuals and sound effects. Vanilla systems have also been improved - no more skipped sounds during heavy action, and water flow is now properly muffled by walls.• Absolute ControlWith 230+ new config options and a redesigned settings menu, you have full control over every sound and endless ways to customise them.I hope you enjoy the changes! Let me know if you have any questions or issues. :) - PlagThis is just the surfaceSupport meCheck out the codeSee the full changelog on Steam!Buy me a coffee on Ko-fi!Give the repo a star on GitHub!SettingsSoundproof Walls Statistics:You've initialized Soundproof Walls [initcount] times.
